com.blahti.drag

Class DragView

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • com.blahti.drag.DragView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback

    public class DragView
extends android.view.View
    A DragView is a special view used by a DragController. During a drag operation, what is actually moving on the screen is a DragView. A DragView is constructed using a bitmap of the view the user really wants to move.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DragView

        public DragView(android.content.Context context)
         throws java.lang.Exception
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • DragView

        public DragView(android.content.Context context,
                android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap,
                int registrationX,
                int registrationY,
                int left,
                int top,
                int width,
                int height)
        Construct the drag view.

        The registration point is the point inside our view that the touch events should be centered upon.

        Parameters:
        context - A context
        bitmap - The view that we're dragging around. We scale it up when we draw it.
        registrationX - The x coordinate of the registration point.
        registrationY - The y coordinate of the registration point.
